comment: Smart Data models - PVArrayConnectionTerminal schema derived from the open connectivity foundation repository https://github.com/openconnectivityfoundation/IoTDataModels adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/PVArrayConnectionTerminal/schema.json
description: This Resource describes functions for the control and monitoring of IEC 61850 based PV Array system connection terminal.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: arraycurrent
contents.comment: Output current of array in Ampere (A)

contents.name: arrayvoltage
contents.comment: Output voltage of array in volts (V)

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: insulationresistance
contents.comment: Insulation resistance of circuit breaker (M Ohm)

contents.name: leakagecurrent
contents.comment: The leakage current in mA

contents.name: n
contents.comment: Friendly name of the Resource

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item

contents.name: ratedarraycurrent
contents.comment: Rated current of array (Nominal values of maximum power current * number of modules) (A), defined at manufacturing time

contents.name: ratedarrayvoltage
contents.comment: Rated voltage of array (Nominal values of maximum power voltage * number of modules) (V)

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: timestamp
contents.comment: An RFC3339 formatted time indicating when the data was observed (e.g.: 2016-02-15T09:19Z, 1996-12-19T16:39:57-08:00). Note that 1/100 time resolution should be used

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: rt
contents.comment: The Resource Type

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
